The 4th of July is a federal holiday in the United States, celebrated on July 4th every year. It commemorates the adoption of the Declaration of Independence on July 4, 1776. The holiday is traditionally celebrated with fireworks, parades, and patriotic music. 

The Declaration of Independence is a document that outlines the 13 original colonies' grievances against King George
